meanings.definition: Quellers: a person or thing that suppresses or extinguishes something
meanings.sent1: The firefighters were the quellers of the raging inferno.
meanings.sent2: The quellers of the noise were the thick curtains in the room.
meanings.sent3: The quellers of the party were the unexpected arrival of the neighbors.
meanings.sent4: Her soothing voice acted as the quellers of his anxiety.
meanings.sent5: The quellers of the storm were the sturdy walls of the house.

meanings.definition: Quellers: to suppress or extinguish something
meanings.sent1: He tried to quellers the flames with a fire extinguisher.
meanings.sent2: The teacher quellers the noise in the classroom by raising her hand.
meanings.sent3: She quellers her laughter when she saw his serious expression.
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain quellers the excitement of the outdoor event.
meanings.sent5: The police officer quellers the protest by calmly addressing the crowd.

meanings.definition: Quellers: those who calm or pacify a situation
meanings.sent1: The quellers in the meeting room helped resolve the conflict peacefully.
meanings.sent2: The quellers at the daycare were skilled at soothing crying children.
meanings.sent3: The quellers at the comedy show made sure everyone had a good time.
meanings.sent4: Her presence acted as the quellers in the tense negotiation.
meanings.sent5: The quellers in the courtroom ensured a fair and just trial.
